intro: Saussurea riederi f. yuparensis, commonly known as the Yuparensis saffron, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cold and dry conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming a composite head that resembles a saffron-like hue. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
